intro: Chamaecrista longicoma, commonly known as the longpod ticktree, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in racemes, and it produces elongated, woody pods that contain several seeds. Chamaecrista longicoma is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
